topic.title: Guy got banned from an linux foundation event for wearing a MAGA hat
topic.body:
So apparently a guy got banned from a linux foundation event for wearing a MAGA hat to a convention. The foundation says it goes against the CoC, I don't know or care that much if it really does. But isn't that a bit too much? It's was not a swastika, it was the merch of a democratically elected president.

My thoughts are:

1 - I think people have the right to not accept others in their property for whatever reason they want, but that doesn't mean I think people should exercise this right at every opportunity.

2 - The blog post raises some valid points about the way the thing was conducted by he linux foundation, doing all of this through public twitter posts is bad management.

3 - I think this is a mix of virtue signaling and fear of bully-by-the-twitter-mob. Reminds me of a book called "Grooming, Gossip and the Evolution of Language" that I've been wanting to read. Grooming is a very important for the structure of primate societies, it relieves stress and strengthens bonds. Maybe online mobs(like gossip) serve a similar purpose in human societies.

Thinking that those people are only doing this because they can't eat the fleas of strangers anymore offer me some "poetic relief".

What do you think about what happened and/or my thoughts? Try not to get into whether you like Trump or not.
 
https://blog.cleancoder.com/uncle-bob/2019/11/08/OpenLetterLinuxFoundation.html

topic.title: Best place to upload videos?
topic.body:
I want to upload a rare Stallman video about the history of copyright law and how to improve it. What are the best zites for this? 
ZeroTube gets stuck on a "Preparing Torrent" message. 
KopyKate works but does anyone use it? Do you have any complains about it?

topic.title: Rare Stallman talk on the history of copyright laws and how to improve it
How to mirror simple sites to zeronet [HTML, JS, CSS, no server side]?
topic.body:
I'm trying to mirror lostallhope.com. I already downloaded everything from wayback machine and it works locally with an HTTP server.
 
tldr: All links are broken and there must be an easier way than fixing one by one.

What I did and how it didn't work.
Copied everything to my new zite address: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FfA8CzMxxmxCqrsMh39CNZbT1qWWaXRrB

Tried to load it and got a bunch of 404s on the browser console. Renaming the urls of the css and js resources to remove the "/" slash at the beginning works but only for the main page. 

I still don't know how to fix images.

topic.title: [Zeronet Mirror] Lost All Hope: Information on suicide methods, statistics and help
topic.body:
Zeronet mirror of the best suicide information site on the web. It contains statistics on the best suicide methods and for people that are unsure, how to find help.

The original at lostallhope.com is down, apparently for maintenance. But we never know when someone will start screaming "think of the children!!!!!" .

Don't forget to add to your personal directories and share with your enemies.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FfA8CzMxxmxCqrsMh39CNZbT1qWWaXRrB/

topic.title: All Persian speakers get in here!! Let's create a Persian ZeroTalk!!
topic.body:
It seems like you guys are having difficulty in creating a Persian forum. I will help! It's quite simple, pick as many sentences below as you like and post them in the comments like this:

25 " comment" " Persian translation"

Note that if there is a space in the beginning of the sentence you *have* to keep it in the translation.
I'm aware that Persian is written from right to left, while English is written left to write. I'm not sure how things will work in this regard.

1 "Follow in Newsfeed"
2 "Following"
3 "Comments in this topic"
4 "New topics"
5 "New topics in this group"
6 "Username mentions"
7 "All comments"

8 "Main"
9 "Loading..."
10 " + Start new topic"
11 "new topic"
12 "Topic title"
13 "Topic description"
14 "Add new topic"

15 "Newest topics"
16 "More topics"
17 "Sign in as..."
18 "Submit comment"
19 "Please sign in"
20 "new comment"

21 "Reply"

22 "stickied"
23 " posted "
24 "last "
25 " comment"
26 " comments"
27 "0 comments"
28 "last activity"
29 "━ started by "

20 " minutes ago"
21 " hours ago"
22 " days ago"
23 "on "
24 "Just now"

topic.title: Pirate Bay now(?) supports in browser streams
topic.body:
There now is a stream button on the search results and torrent pages. I think this feature is new, at least I had never noticed it before.
It surely uses webtorrent.

topic.title: How to you mange your zite's urls?
topic.body:
If you are using a normal browser you could use the bookmarks. But then you would be using a normal browser.
Tor Browser doesn't save bookmarks so you would have to keep them in a text file, which is inconvenient.
Creating a directory in a zite sounds inconvenient. And what if I don't want my bookmarks to potentially become public? There is no way to black list a zite so that it's not uploaded.
HelloZero does have a bookmarks but you can't organize them into directories, which is bad.

I guess it would be very nice if HelloZero bookmarks could be organized into directories.

topic.title: [PERSIAN ]Help translating other parts of ZeronNet (Main page, email and social network)
topic.body:
Hello Persian friends! I don't speak your language so I need help translating ZeroNet. Peek as many as you want and post it with the translation. For example: 61 " sites in ": "", Becomes: 61 " sites in ": " Persian translation here", Please note that if there is a white space in the beginning of the original then you should keep it. Remember to keep the semicolons(the ':' symbol in the middle), the comma (',' symbol at the end) and the number in the beginning. Some sentences may be repeated, don't skip them or the numbers will get messed up. Be nice and try to post it in the right order. Fell free to post any questions below. Things to be translated: 1 "Opened": "", 2 "Closed": "", 3 "_(Disabled)": "", 4 "_(Error)": "", 5 "Status: ": ": ", 6 "Nice! Your port \" + Page.server_info.fileserver_port + \" is opened.": "", 7 "Re-check opened port": "", 8 "How to make Tor connection work?": "", 9 "How to use ZeroNet in Tor Browser?": "", 10 "Disable always Tor mode": "", 11 "Enable Tor for every connection (slower)": "", 12 "Help to keep this project alive": "", 13 "Updating to latest version...
Please restart ZeroNet manually if it does not come back in the next few minutes.": "", 14 "Internet Explorer is not fully supported browser by ZeroNet, please consider switching to Chrome or Firefox": "", 15 "Welcome to ZeroNet": "", 16 "Let's build a decentralized Internet together!": "", 17 "This site currently served by ": "", 18 " peers, without any central server.": "", 19 "Some sites we created:": "", 20 "Simple messaging board": "", 21 "Reddit-like, decentralized forum": "", 22 "Activate \\u2501": "", 23 "Microblogging platform": "", 24 "End-to-end encrypted mailing": "", 25 "P2P social network": "", 26 "Update all sites": "", 27 "Order sites by peers": "", 28 "Order sites by update time": "", 29 "Order sites by add time": "", 30 "Order sites by size": "", 31 "Version ": "", 32 "New version avalible!": "", 33 "Up to date!": "", 34 "Shut down ZeroNet": "", 35 "_(Sites)": "", 36 "_(Files)": "", 37 "Favorited sites:": "", 38 "Connected sites:": "", 39 "More sites:": "", 40 " file update failed": "", 41 "No peers": "", 42 "Update failed": "", 43 "Updating...": "", 44 "Updated!": "", 45 "Updating: ": "", 46 " left": "", 47 "Are you sure?": "", 48 "Activate \\u00BB": "", 49 "Unfavorite": "", 50 "Favorite": "", 51 "Update": "", 52 "Clone": "", 53 "Resume": "", 54 "Pause": "", 56 "Check files": "", 57 "Delete": "", 58 "Sorry, you can't delete your own site.
Please remove the directory manually.": "", 59 "Search in connected sites": "", 60 " results from ": "", 61 " sites in ": "", 62 "s": "", 63 "Comment on": "", 64 "You got mentioned in": "", 65 "You got mentioned": "", 66 "Used: ": "", 67 "Edit optional files limit": "", 68 "Optional files limit:": "", 69 "Cancel": "", 70 "Set": "", 71 "Selected:": "", 72 " files": "", 73 "Pin": "", 74 "UnPin": topic.title: What is it with all the schizo posting today?
topic.body:
Do not reply to schizo posters.
Ignore schizo posts.
If you want to schizo post go to one of the low IQ boards on [8chan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/).

1573243995_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body:
> [blahblah69](#comment_21_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4j8d6q): I'm not a trump fanatic however there is a reason he got elected

I agree, this antagonizing approach is a disservice they do to themselves. They would have much more sympathizers  if they were more friendly. Of course you can get allies faster at first if your discourse is harsh, you will attract radical, unreasonable people quick. But it's not a sustainable.

I liked this more widespread concern with the less fortunate at first but their means drove me away.

1573249492_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body: I think I will settle with KopyKate while I don't find anything else.

Yeah, my bad. Didn't notice I had stopped the daemon.

Oh wait, I hadn't stopped it. Idk why it wasn't working for you.

> [moor](#comment_300_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): it isn't working for whatever reason, maybe reupload it?

I will do that. KopyKate says that there are 2 peers now.

I couldn't find any other place to upload to. ZeroUp only allows for up to 200MB and ZeroTube doesn't work.
Is anyone able to see the video at all?

> [moor](#comment_301_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): it should work on kopykate just fine. i also tried watching your other video but it wasn't working either... maybe restart your client?!

Just did that. I think I could see your requests in the zeronet output, idk why it's not working.

I'm using Tor, I think you need to be using it too to download the file from me. Maybe that?
Edit: My port is also closed. Maybe that?

> [moor](#comment_302_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): weird, tor was enabled already, i just restarted my client and its working now.

Good!
And now this thread has 20 comments and everyone will come here thinking it's a great talk(it is) and we were talking about it.

1573303435_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93Kusgx.body:
lostallhope.com is under maintenance. See the archive: https://archive.ph/2liAl
It's a compilation of suicides methods and their statistical rates of success.

I made a mirror of lostallhope.com, the site I posted below, here on zeronet. There you can find help if you are unsure if you really want to do it. It also includes statistics on the best methods. 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FfA8CzMxxmxCqrsMh39CNZbT1qWWaXRrB/

> [kaar4bears](#comment_35_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93KusgxDCqsr): Thanks. Weirdly, I may be able to purchase cyanide, but opinions on whether it is instant/painless are mixed. If it was so unreliable, why do spies use them in suicide pills?

According to the site cyanide is almost as good as shotgun to the head, which surprisingly doesn't have 100% efficiency. 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FfA8CzMxxmxCqrsMh39CNZbT1qWWaXRrB/suicide-methods/statistics-most-lethal-methods/

> [kaar4bears](#comment_41_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93KusgxDCqsr): Nothing is perfect, and people make mistakes. It's impossible to have a 100% success rate in anything ever

Yes, but it's rated at 99,0%. Think about how much people shot themselves to the head with a shotgun. I would expect it to be 99,99%, or maybe so close to 100% that there is no point in not rounding it.

1573312646_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body: Thanks! But I don't use windows or proprietary software and this is just a binary :/
I searched the binary name and found about the httrack project. It is open source but I'm not sure whether it suits my use case. I have to clone a website from the wayback machine.

> [pollux](#comment_8_1EAVtUrWmi9Z1pEwXsPof1hrtBB8SKcZsm): Try to use "./" instead of just "/" at the start of the URLs.

This was a good first step. It still can't find images. 

Pages that are within a sub directory such as helpme/index.html can't find js and css resources in the parent directory. Any idea of how to solve this without having to rename everything? I used find and sed to replace "/ with "./

The mirror is up an running. The browser still gives one 404 error because I found it easier to just delete the google analytics files instead of searching and destroying all the script tags. I will make another thread so people can see it.

Thanks to everyone that helped. In the end I had to correct all urls to include a "." in the beginning and added "/../../" to things in sub directories.

Thanks to the original developer of the site and the developers of the GNU Sed and the wayback-machine-downloader as well.

> [lianna](#comment_24_16ePf6TBgip2eF88AxhnRJdPXyZJK1V2S4): wget \ [...]

I would just get wayback machine pages with that. Besides I had already downloaded the site, the difficulty was in making it work properly on zeronet without having to manually rewrite every url.

I did manage to do it with the help of others though. Link in the OP and "announcement" here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1573322616_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6jdkK7/+Zeronet+Mirror+Lost+All+Hope+Information+on+suicide+methods+statistics+and+help

1575523101_1GDtf6kkYiCtruw42QmAeaHG1HsrW.body:
The solution is to go full libre.
For app, signal is probably the best option.
For device+OS you could use:
A common device with a android fork such as lineageOS installed.
A fully libre ReplicantOS(android fork) phone;
The PinePhone(GNU+Linux based) phone, which is very cheap(atm only selling developer phones, I think);
Librem Phone(GNU+Linux based) high end phone.

But, the information here is lacking tbh. Not much methods, not much pill cocktails, I definitely would like more, especially "peaceful" style methods.

I made this zite, it's a mirror from lostallhope.com, which was offline for maintenance. But we never know when someone will start screaming "tHINK oF tHE cHILDREN!111!!".

> [filips](#comment_340_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): @clearnet15bad If you are going to create Persian ZeroTalk, just one thing: [...]

Github doesn't like me and my accounts always get locked.(I use disposable emails) Can i just send the js file to you through here (or pastebin)?

> [filips](#comment_341_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Yes, sure.

The file is here. The language code for persian is "fa".
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6jdkK7_0

> [xcape2net](#comment_604_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): How do you create a separate database, so posts are not visible on ZeroTalk.  Everything I tried failed.

Just cloning the zite should be enough. Are you following [this](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/2355#issuecomment-562996763) steps?
Anyways, it's probably easier to wait a few hours(or minutes) until the persian translation is available. Otherwise you will have to copy and paste the translation file in your zite's directory (that's not hard to do, if you are really in a hurry).

I just realized how silly my last comment was. Iran blocked the internet so you can't see the steps. 

Go to the HelloZero (ZeroNet's initial page) and on the left panel search for ZeroTalk. Then click the three dots by the side of "ZeroTalk" and then click "Clone".

> [xcape2net](#comment_605_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I'm not in Iran.  I'm just a bystander who wants to get them to post somewhere else.  And, no, I didn't see the steps, but "Configure cloned site as you want. [...]

I followed the same steps and got an empty zite. 0.o

> [xcape2net](#comment_606_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): What do you mean "empty"?

There are no posts in it. Isn't that what you are talking about?

It just works™on my machine. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KT1L7WzUvwt5DkUwAWeE7iorWPL3Zzofc

Aren't you missing a step?

> [xcape2net](#comment_607_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I got that far.  The problem I'm having is with the database.

Then there should be no problem. You get an empty zite. Posts on your zite stay on your zite.

> [xcape2net](#comment_608_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Do you see my "test" message inside your "testerino" post appearing in ZeroTalk?  I do.

Yes. I see it. It's just: "Test.".

> [xcape2net](#comment_609_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): So you are having the same problem I am.  We need to figure out how to keep posts to your site from also appearing on ZeroTalk, otherwise we will see every Persian post and comment that they post on their site.

What? I'm not seeing my "testerino" topic on ZeroTalk, just on the zite I linked.

VERY weird. Check whether you are using the last version of ZeroNet. The zites have different addresses, there should be no mixing.
Are you sure you are not seeing it in the ZeroHello news feed? The news feed and ZeroTalk are different things.
Yes. Go on the zite, at the top, besides the large "New Topics" there is a button that for you should read "Following", click to change to to "Follow in News Feed".
Then uncheck the ones that you don't want(on the persian forum).

> [xcape2net](#comment_615_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Do I need to publish or anything?
No. It's a per user setting.

> [xcape2net](#comment_614_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): That doesn't seem to have worked--as you can see on ZeroHello.

I can't see anything. This is a per user settings. I follow completely different stuff that you don't get to see either.

> [xcape2net](#comment_616_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): OK.  So any site that I have seeded on my computer should appear in MY ZeroHello page unless I unfollow it.  I understand now how it's supposed to work.  Not sure why it isn't working that way, but this means that my site should be working correctly in theory.  I just need to add the translations and try to unfollow the Persian conversations--assuming they will use my site and get off ZeroTalk..

Correct.

> [xcape2net](#comment_617_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Thank you.  Hopefully, I can get them to move to my website and turn over the keys to someone who wants to moderate it.

I think you can add moderators. Turning the keys over is kinda silly since you have no way to prove that you deleted them.

> [filips](#comment_349_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): I created PR #94 but there is already PR #93. They looks a bit different so which one has most correct translations?

93 is missing "More Comments", the text I posted on the OP is missing it too but I added it afterwards.
94 is fine.

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:

> [mubuntu](#comment_1_1PzwHMpLD72fYUw5W4AVFZ8Ae28m18Cjvv): what is the difference between this and IPFS?

IPFS is only for file sharing and it's content addressed. That means that if two files on IPFS have the same content you only need to download them once.

135 "'s ": "**not clear*",
That's a possessive. Like in "zaefarani's post".

136 "(post, like post)": "",**Needs some disambiguation**
137 "(post, comment post)": "",**Needs some disambiguation**
I believe those are the text on buttons. Such as a like button or a comment button.

160 "'s new images": "تصاویر جدید مربوط به",**Needs some disambiguation**
Refers to the images of a user. What exactly is not clear?

> [zaefarani](#comment_3_15qRtdHeM5SR3LMj9iBkxYGAKj61r4fF9S): [135,160]what I mean by saying disambiguation is that those words needed to be translated in the sentence and you could not concatenate the meanings together to get the results. > [zaefarani](#comment_5_15qRtdHeM5SR3LMj9iBkxYGAKj61r4fF9S): I'd be happy to help by more of these translations or anything else if I could in the future and thank you for speeding up this work

Thanks. We already translated: ZeroTalk, ZeroMail, ZeroMe and ZeroHello (the later tree were done by you :-) ). If you would like to translate other official pages check the repositories on the project's [github page](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet?tab=repositories). All of the repositories for zites should have a "languages" directory with language files inside it, just copy one of the files and change the translations inside it to Persian.
